marketNews.title: Minor IHSG Evaluation, BBRI Weight Rises 2.25%
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) on June 24, 2024 announced the results of the minor evaluation of the IHSG index for the effective period of July 1-September 30, 2024. This evaluation includes changes in the weight of several stocks in the index, with Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) experiencing the most significant weight increase of 2.25 percentage points from 6.75% to 9%. To determine a stock's weight in the IHSG, the IDX uses a free float adjusted index and applies a maximum cap of 9%. In the previous evaluation in March 2024, BBRI received a weight of 9%. However, the decline in BBRI's stock price over the last 3 months caused its weight to drop to 6.75% before the June 2024 evaluation was conducted. The weight increase for BBRI in the June 2024 evaluation was driven by an increase in the maximum quota of BBRI's free float shares calculated by the IDX to determine the weighting in the index. Previously, the number of BBRI free float shares calculated in the March 2024 evaluation was 43.4 billion shares, equivalent to the maximum weight limit of 9% at that time. However, the number of BBRI free float shares calculated in the June 2024 evaluation rose to 60 billion shares and reached the maximum weight of 9%. Although the calculated free float shares increased, BBRI still has remaining free float shares that have not yet been calculated because BBRI free float shares as of May 2024 reached 70.1 billion shares. Following BBRI, several other issuers that experienced the largest weight increases were TPIA (+0.12 percentage point) and MDKA (+0.08 percentage point). Meanwhile, the largest weight decreases were experienced by AMRT (-0.27 percentage point), BMRI (-0.24 percentage point), and AMMN (-0.16 percentage point). The next evaluation of the IHSG index will be conducted in September 2024, with the effective period of October 1-December 31, 2024. Key Takeaway: This weighting can affect investors, especially institutional investors who use the IHSG as a benchmark or passive institutional investors who follow the IHSG index. Since the announcement of the latest index weighting on June 24, 2024, BBRI's stock price has risen about +11% as of July 4, 2024. Furthermore, foreign investors recorded a foreign net buy in BBRI shares of 550 billion rupiah on June 28, or one day before this evaluation's effective period came into force. It is important to note that there are still BBRI free float shares that have not been calculated for IHSG weighting. Consequently, if BBRI's weight falls again in the future due to a stock price decline, BBRI's weighting can rise again.

marketNews.title: US Democratic Party considering Kamala Harris to replace Joe Biden if he steps aside
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Democratic Party in the US is considering US Vice President Kamala Harris as the main alternative to replace President Joe Biden in the election race if Biden decides to step aside. Previously, Biden's poor performance with incoherent statements during the debate against Donald Trump sparked concerns from the Democratic Party that he might not be healthy enough to serve a second term.

marketNews.title: Kadin asks government to be selective in imposing 200% import duty
marketNews.content: The Deputy Chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin), Juan Permata Adoe, requested that the government be more selective in determining imported products that will be subject to a 200% import duty. If not selective, Juan assessed that import restrictions could complicate domestic industries if the 200% import duty is imposed on raw materials and auxiliary materials, especially those that cannot yet be produced in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Renewable Energy Mix Target for 2025 Difficult to Achieve Due to Investment Realization,
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Eniya Listiani Dewi, stated that the less than significant realization of investment in the new and renewable energy (EBT) sector is one of the reasons hindering the EBT mix target of 23% in 2025. As of 2023, the EBT mix only reached 13.1%. Eniya explained that investment hurdles in the EBT sector are caused by factors including Domestic Component Level (TKDN) and collaboration. To resolve these issues, Eniya said that the Ministry of Industry and the Ministry of ESDM will issue ministerial regulations before the current government's term ends.

marketNews.title: Garuda Indonesia CEO asks Ministry of Transportation to eliminate upper-limit tariff policy for air tickets
marketNews.content: The President Director of Garuda Indonesia (GIAA), Irfan Setiaputra, asked the Ministry of Transportation to abolish the upper-limit tariff (TBA) policy for airline tickets. Irfan mentioned that the TBA, which has not been increased since 2019, caused GIAA's average fare per pax to decrease.

marketNews.title: Director General of Applications and Informatics at Kominfo announces resignation following ransomware attack on PDNS
marketNews.content: The Director General of Applications and Informatics at the Ministry of Communication and Informatics, Semuel Abrijani Pangerapan, announced his resignation from his position. Semuel explained that this step is a form of accountability for the ransomware attack on the Temporary National Data Center.

tickerNews.title: Superbank Owned by EMTK Receives Capital Injection of Rp1.2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: EMTK: Elang Mahkota Teknologi's digital bank entity, PT Super Bank Indonesia (Superbank), received an additional investment worth 1.2 trillion rupiah from Grab, Singtel, and KakaoBank. The President Director of Superbank, Tigor M. Siahaan, said that this additional investment will strengthen the company in expanding financial and financing services for underbanked MSMEs in Indonesia. Previously, Superbank launched a feature integrated with Grab at the end of June 2024, allowing users to open accounts in the ride-hailing application. MIDI: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded a same store sales growth (SSSG) of +9.64% YoY during 1H24, exceeding management's 2024 guidance of +6% YoY and marking the highest growth since 2022. Meanwhile, SSSG in 2Q24 reached +6.10% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +13.67% YoY) along with post-Ramadan normalization. During 1H24, MIDI opened 75 new Alfamidi stores (vs. 1H23: 27 stores), equivalent to 37.5% of the 2024 target of 200 new stores.

tickerNews.title: Saratoga Directors increase stakes in SRTG through long-term incentive program execution
tickerNews.content: SRTG: Saratoga Investama Sedaya Directors, Lany Djuwita Wong and Devin Wirawan, each purchased 836,700 and 831,500 SRTG shares at a price of 1,480 rupiah per share on July 1, 2024. The total transaction value for both reached approximately 2.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Lany Djuwita Wong's ownership in SRTG increased from 0.03% to 0.04%, while Devin Wirawan's ownership increased from 0.04% to 0.05%. This transaction is part of the execution of the company's long-term incentive program.

tickerNews.title: PANI reports Hotel Nusantara in IKN is 90% complete and nearing operation
tickerNews.content: PANI: The Corporate Secretary of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua, Christy Grassela, told Kontan that the construction progress of Hotel Nusantara in IKN has reached 90% and will operate in the near future. Hotel Nusantara itself is built by PT Kusuma Putra Alam, in which PANI owns an 11.12% stake in the company. In its initial phase, Hotel Nusantara is targeted to have 100 rooms.

tickerNews.title: BRMS aims to meet 2024 gold production target of 35,000 troy ounces, supported by new plant completion
tickerNews.content: BRMS: The Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Herwin Hidayat, stated that they are optimistic about meeting the gold production target of 35,000 troy ounces in 2024, which is +50.4% higher than the 2023 realization of 23,270 troy ounces. This optimism is supported by the completion of the construction of a new gold plant with a capacity of 4,000 tons of ore per day in Palu, Central Sulawesi, targeted for completion in 2H24. Currently, BRMS operates 2 gold plants in Palu, with capacities of 500 tons and 4,000 tons of ore per day, respectively. The company is also working on constructing a gold plant with a capacity of 2,000 tons of ore per day in Gorontalo, targeted for completion in June 2026.

tickerNews.title: Controlling shareholder of TSPC increases ownership after purchasing 1.42 million shares
tickerNews.content: TSPC: The controller of Tempo Scan Pacific, PT Bogamulia Nagadi, purchased approximately 1.42 million TSPC shares at an average price of 1,960.3 rupiah per share on June 19, 2024. The total transaction value was approximately 2.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Bogamulia Nagadi in TSPC increased from 87.58% to 87.62%.

tickerNews.title: TMAS secures Rp300 billion loan from controller for capex to boost business capacity
tickerNews.content: TMAS: Temas secured a loan of 300 billion rupiah from its controller, PT Temas Lestari, with a maturity period until December 31, 2025. The loan is intended for capex to increase business capacity.
